longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: An Ordinance to render discrimination, harassment and vilification, on the ground of race, unlawful; to prohibit serious vilification of persons on that ground; to extend the jurisdiction of the Equal Opportunities Commission to include such unlawful acts; to confer on the Commission the function of eliminating such discrimination, harassment and vilification and promoting equality and harmony between people of different races; to amend certain definitions, and the provisions on discrimination against contract workers, in existing anti-discrimination legislation as well as the provision on unlawful sexual harassment by creating a hostile or intimidating environment in the Sex Discrimination Ordinance for alignment with corresponding provisions in this Ordinance; to make other consequential and related amendments to enactments; and for related purposes.

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Race Discrimination Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: access (獲得、享用) means access as construed in accordance with section 53;
act (作為) includes a deliberate omission;

def.name: Advertisement
def.leadIn: advertisement (廣告) includes every form of advertisement, whether to the public or not, and whether—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in a newspaper or other publication;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by television or radio;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by display of notices, signs, labels, showcards or goods;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by distribution of samples, circulars, catalogues, price lists or other material;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: by exhibition of pictures, models or films; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: in any other way;

subsection.def: associate (有聯繫者), in relation to a person, includes—(a)a spouse of the person;(b)another person who is living with the person on a genuine domestic basis;(c)a relative of the person;(d)a carer of the person; and(e)another person who is in a business, sporting or recreational relationship with the person; (Added 8 of 2020 s. 12)

carer (照料者) includes—(a)the Director of Social Welfare;(b)any officer of the Social Welfare Department authorized in writing by the Director of Social Welfare;(c)any person specified in Schedule 6; (Added 8 of 2020 s. 12)

club (會社) means an association, incorporate or unincorporate, of not less than 30 persons associated together for social, literary, cultural, political, sporting, athletic or other lawful purposes and which provides and maintains its facilities, in whole or in part, from the funds of the association;

def.name: CommencementDate

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date appointed under section 1(2) for that provision to come into operation; or

paragraph.name: b

subsection.def: commission agent (佣金經紀人) means a commission agent as construed in accordance with section 22;
committee of management (管理委員會), in relation to a club, means the group or body of persons (howsoever described) that manages the affairs of the club;
conciliator (調停人) means any person engaged by the Commission under section 64(2)(e) of the Sex Discrimination Ordinance (Cap. 480); (Amended 15 of 2012 s. 11)
contract worker (合約工作者) means a contract worker as construed in accordance with section 15;
dynamically supported craft (動力承托的航行器) has the same meaning as in the Shipping and Port Control Ordinance (Cap. 313);
education (教育) includes any form of training or instruction;
educational establishment (教育機構) means an educational establishment specified in column 2 of Schedule 1;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a contract of service or of apprenticeship; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a contract personally to execute any work or labour;

def.name: EmploymentAgency
def.leadIn: employment agency (職業介紹所) means a person who, for profit or not, provides services for the purpose of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: finding employment for workers; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: supplying employers with workers;

subsection.def: enforcement notice (執行通知) means a notice served under section 71(2);
estate agent (地產代理) has the same meaning as in the Estate Agents Ordinance (Cap. 511);
formal investigation (正式調查) means an investigation conducted under section 64;

general notice (一般通告), in relation to a person, means a notice published by the person at a time and in a manner appearing to the person suitable for securing that the notice is seen within a reasonable time by persons likely to be affected by it;
genuine occupational qualification (真正的職業資格) means a genuine occupational qualification as construed in accordance with section 11(2);
harass (騷擾) means to harass within the meaning of section 7(1) or (2);
intern (實習人員)—section 24A(2); (Added 8 of 2020 s. 29)
internship (實習)—section 24A(2); (Added 8 of 2020 s. 29)

def.name: NearRelative
def.leadIn: near relative (近親), in relation to a person, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person’s spouse;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a parent of the person or of the spouse;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a child of the person or the spouse of such a child;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a brother or sister (whether of full blood or half blood) of the person or of the spouse or the spouse of such a brother or sister;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a grandparent of the person or of the spouse; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a grandchild of the person or the spouse of such a grandchild,

def.continued: and, in determining the above relationships, children born out of wedlock are to be included, an adopted child is to be regarded as a child of both the natural parents and the adoptive parent or parents and a step child as the child of both the natural parents and any step parent;

subsection.def: notice (通告、通知) means a notice in writing;
prescribed (訂明) means prescribed in rules made under section 82;
profession (專業) includes any vocation or occupation;
pupillage (見習職位)—see section 35(4); (Added 8 of 2020 s. 29)
responsible body (負責組織), in relation to an educational establishment, means the body specified in column 3 of Schedule 1 opposite to that establishment;
trade (行業) includes any business;
training (訓練) includes any form of education or instruction; (Amended 8 of 2020 s. 29)
volunteer (義工)—see section 24A(2). (Added 8 of 2020 s. 29)

subsection.content: References in this Ordinance to race, on the ground of race and racial group shall be construed in accordance with section 8.

subsection.leadIn: References in this Ordinance to the dismissal of a person from employment or to the expulsion of a person from a position as partner include references—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to the termination of that person’s employment or partnership by the expiration of any period (including a period expiring by reference to an event or circumstance), not being a termination immediately after which the employment or partnership is renewed on the same terms;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to the termination of that person’s employment or partnership by any act of that person (including the giving of notice) in circumstances such that that person is entitled to terminate it without notice by reason of the conduct of the employer, or the other partners, as the case may be.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Ordinance, an enforcement notice or a finding by the District Court becomes final when an appeal against the notice or finding is dismissed, withdrawn or abandoned or when the time for appealing expires without an appeal having been brought; and for this purpose an appeal against an enforcement notice is taken to be dismissed if, notwithstanding that a requirement of the notice is quashed on appeal, a direction is given in respect of it under section 72(3).

def.name: ExistingStatutoryProvision
def.leadIn: Subject to subsection (6), in this Ordinance, existing statutory provision (現有法例條文) means a provision of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an Ordinance enacted before this Ordinance was enacted; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any subsidiary legislation made—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: under an Ordinance enacted before this Ordinance was enacted; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: before, on or after the enactment of this Ordinance.

subsection.content: Where an Ordinance, enacted after this Ordinance was enacted, re-enacts (with or without modifications) a provision of an Ordinance enacted before this Ordinance was enacted, then that provision as re-enacted is to be treated for the purposes of subsection (5) as if it continued to be contained in an Ordinance enacted before this Ordinance was enacted.

The Secretary for Justice may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend this Ordinance by substituting, for a reference to the commencement date of a provision, the actual calendar date appointed for the commencement of that provision.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Discrimination and Harassment to which this Ordinance Applies

subsection.leadIn: In any circumstances relevant for the purposes of any provision of this Ordinance, a person (the discriminator) discriminates against another person if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the ground of the race of that other person, the discriminator treats that other person less favourably than the discriminator treats or would treat other persons; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the discriminator applies to that other person a requirement or condition which the discriminator applies or would apply equally to persons not of the same racial group as that other person but—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: which is such that the proportion of persons of the same racial group as that other person who can comply with it is considerably smaller than the proportion of persons not of that racial group who can comply with it;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: which the discriminator cannot show to be justifiable irrespective of the race of the person to whom it is applied; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: which is to the detriment of the other person because that person cannot comply with it.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(b)(ii), a requirement or condition is justifiable if it serves a legitimate objective and bears a rational and proportionate connection to the objective.

It is declared that, for the purposes of this Ordinance, segregating a person from other persons on the ground of the race of that person is treating that person less favourably than the other persons are treated.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Discrimination on the ground of race of associate
section.content: In any circumstances relevant for the purposes of any provision of this Ordinance, a person (the discriminator) discriminates against another person (the relevant person) if, on the ground of the race of an associate of the relevant person, the discriminator treats the relevant person less favourably than the discriminator treats or would treat another person not having an associate of the same racial group as the associate of the relevant person.

subsection.leadIn: A person (the discriminator) discriminates against another person (the person victimized) in any circumstances relevant for the purposes of any provision of this Ordinance if the discriminator treats the person victimized less favourably than in those circumstances the discriminator treats or would treat other persons, and does so—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: by reason that the person victimized or any other person (the third person) has—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: brought proceedings against the discriminator or any other person under this Ordinance;

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: otherwise done anything under or by reference to this Ordinance in relation to the discriminator or any other person; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: alleged that the discriminator or any other person has committed an act which (whether or not the allegation so states) would amount to a contravention of this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: by reason that the discriminator—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: knows the person victimized or the third person, as the case may be, intends to do any of those things; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: suspects the person victimized or the third person, as the case may be, has done, or intends to do, any of them.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not apply to treatment of a person by reason of any allegation made by that person if the allegation was false and not made in good faith.

In any circumstances relevant for the purposes of any provision of this Ordinance, a person harasses another person if, on the ground of the race of that other person or an associate of that other person, the first-mentioned person engages in unwelcome conduct (which may include an oral or a written statement), in circumstances in which a reasonable person, having regard to all the circumstances, would have anticipated that the other person would be offended, humiliated or intimidated by that conduct.

In any circumstances relevant for the purposes of any provision of this Ordinance, a person (the first-mentioned person) harasses another person (the second-mentioned person) if, on the ground of the race of the second-mentioned person or his or her associate, the first-mentioned person, alone or together with other persons, engages in conduct (which may include an oral or a written statement) that creates a hostile or intimidating environment for the second-mentioned person.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Meaning of race, on the ground of race, racial group and comparison of cases of persons or different racial groups

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance and subject to subsections (2) and (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: race (種族), in relation to a person, means the race, colour, descent or national or ethnic origin of the person, and includes a race, colour, descent or national or ethnic origin that is imputed to the person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a reference to an act done on the ground of the race of a person is a reference to an act done on the ground of— (Amended 8 of 2020 s. 18)

paragraph.content: the race, colour, descent or national or ethnic origin of the person; or
the race, colour, descent or national or ethnic origin that is imputed to the person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an act constitutes discrimination on the ground of descent only if it constitutes discrimination against members of communities based on forms of social stratification such as caste and analogous systems of inherited status which nullify or impair their equal enjoyment of human rights; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.def: racial group (種族群體) means a group of persons defined by reference to race, colour, descent or national or ethnic origin, and references to a person’s racial group refer to any racial group into which the person falls or is imputed to fall. (Amended 8 of 2020 s. 18)

subsection.content: An act done on the ground of any matter specified in subsection (3) does not constitute an act done on the ground of the race, colour, descent or national or ethnic origin of a person; and section 4(1)(b) does not apply to a requirement or condition as to any matter specified in subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: The matters specified in this subsection are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that the person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is or is not an indigenous inhabitant of the New Territories; or

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that the person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is or is not a Hong Kong permanent resident;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has or has not the right of abode or the right to land in Hong Kong;

subparagraph.name: iii
iv

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the length of residence in Hong Kong of the person; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the nationality, citizenship or resident status of the person under the law of any country or place concerning nationality, citizenship, resident status or naturalization of or in that country or place.

subsection.content: The fact that a racial group comprises 2 or more distinct racial groups does not prevent it from constituting a particular racial group for the purposes of this Ordinance.

A comparison under section 4(1) of the case of a person of a particular racial group with that of a person not of that group must be such that the relevant circumstances in the one case are the same, or not materially different, in the other.

subsection.leadIn: A comparison of the cases under section 5 of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person having an associate who is of a particular racial group; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person not having an associate who is of that group,

subsection.continued: must be such that the relevant circumstances in the one case are the same as, or not materially different from, those in the other. (Replaced 8 of 2020 s. 15)

section.name: s9
section.heading: Act done for racial and other reason

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an act is done for 2 or more reasons; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: one of the reasons is the race of a person (whether or not it is the dominant reason or a substantial reason for doing the act),

section.continued: then, for the purposes of this Ordinance, the act is taken to be done for the reason of the race of the person.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Discrimination and Harassment in Employment Field

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a person (the employer), in relation to employment by the employer at an establishment in Hong Kong, to discriminate against another person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the arrangements the employer makes for the purpose of determining who should be offered that employment;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the terms on which the employer offers that other person employment; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by refusing, or deliberately omitting to offer, the other person that employment.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for an employer, in the case of a person employed by that employer at an establishment in Hong Kong, to discriminate against that employee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the terms of employment which the employer affords that employee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the way the employer affords the employee access to opportunities for promotion, transfer or training, or to any other benefits, facilities or services, or by refusing or deliberately omitting to afford the employee access to them; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by dismissing the employee, or subjecting him or her to any other detriment.

subsection.content: Except in relation to discrimination falling within section 6, subsections (1) and (2) do not apply to employment when the number of persons employed by the employer, added to the number employed by any associated employers of that employer, does not exceed 5. This subsection does not apply to the employment by a person of another person to perform domestic duties on the premises on which the first-mentioned person or his or her near relative resides.

Subject to subsection (5), subsections (1)(b) and (2) do not apply to provision in relation to death or retirement for a person made before the commencement date* in so far as any such provision continues for that person on and after that date.

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (1)(b) and (2) apply to provision made in relation to retirement of the kind mentioned in subsection (4) in so far as, in their application to such provision, they render it unlawful for a person (the employer) to discriminate against another person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in such of the terms on which the employer offers that other person employment as make provision in relation to the way in which the employer will afford that other person access to opportunities for promotion, transfer or training or as provide for that other person’s dismissal or demotion;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the way the employer affords that other person opportunities for promotion, transfer or training, or by refusing or deliberately omitting to afford that other person access to any such opportunities; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by dismissing that other person or subjecting that other person to any detriment which results in that other person’s dismissal or consists in or involves that other person’s demotion.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) does not apply to benefits, facilities or services of any description if the employer is concerned with the provision (for payment or not) of benefits, facilities or services of that description to the public, or to a section of the public comprising the employee in question, unless—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the provision of the benefits, facilities or services to the employee in question is regulated by the employee’s contract of employment; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the benefits, facilities or services relate to training.

subsection.content: Except in relation to discrimination falling within section 5 or 6, nothing in subsection (1)(a) or (c) renders it unlawful for a person to discriminate against another person on the ground of the race of that other person, in connection with employment to perform domestic duties on the premises on which the first-mentioned person or his or her near relative resides.
Subsection (3) expires on the third anniversary of the day on which this Ordinance is enacted.

For the purposes of subsection (3), 2 employers are to be treated as associated if one is a company of which the other (directly or indirectly) has control or if both are companies of which a third person (directly or indirectly) has control.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may, by notice published in the Gazette, do either or both of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: amend subsection (3) by substituting another number for the number appearing after the word “exceed” in that subsection;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: amend subsection (8) by substituting another anniversary for the anniversary appearing in that subsection.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to discrimination falling within section 4—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 10(1)(a) and (c) does not apply to any employment where being of a particular racial group is a genuine occupational qualification for the job; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 10(2)(b) does not apply to opportunities for promotion or transfer to, or training for, such employment.

subsection.leadIn: Being of a particular racial group is a genuine occupational qualification only where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the job involves participation in a dramatic performance or other entertainment in a capacity for which a person of that racial group is required for reasons of authenticity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the job involves participation as an artist’s or photographic model in the production of a work of art, visual images or sequence of visual images for which a person of that racial group is required for reasons of authenticity;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the job involves working in a place where food or drink is (for payment or not) provided to and consumed by members of the public or a section of the public in a particular setting for which, in that job, a person of that racial group is required for reasons of authenticity;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the holder of the job provides persons of that racial group with personal services promoting their welfare, and those services can most effectively be provided by a person of that racial group; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the job involves providing persons of that racial group with personal services of such nature or in such circumstances as to require familiarity with the language, culture and customs of and sensitivity to the needs of that racial group, and those services can most effectively be provided by a person of that racial group.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Exception for employment intended to provide training in skills to be exercised outside Hong Kong
section.content: Without prejudice to section 8(2) and (3), nothing in section 10 renders unlawful any act done by an employer for the benefit of a person not ordinarily resident in Hong Kong in or in connection with employing the person at an establishment in Hong Kong, where the purpose of that employment is to provide the person with training in skills which the person appears to the employer to intend to exercise wholly outside Hong Kong.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Exception for employment of person with special skills, knowledge or experience

subsection.leadIn: Nothing in section 10 renders unlawful any act done by an employer for the benefit of any person in or in connection with employing the person at an establishment in Hong Kong, where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the employment requires special skills, knowledge or experience not readily available in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: possesses those skills, knowledge or experience; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is recruited or transferred from a place outside Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the act is reasonably done for a person so recruited or transferred, having regard to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the prevailing terms of employment offered to persons with those skills, knowledge or experience in places outside Hong Kong; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any other relevant circumstances (other than the race of the person).

subsection.leadIn: Where in an employment of a person to which subsection (1) or this subsection applies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the employment terminates and is immediately followed by renewal or re-engagement (whether or not on the same terms);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person is promoted; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person is transferred within the same group of companies,

subsection.continued: nothing in section 10 renders unlawful any act done, by the employer or the employer upon transfer (as the case may be), for the benefit of the person in or in connection with the renewal, re-engagement, promotion or transfer, or in or in connection with the employment pursuant to it, so long as the act is reasonably done for the person having regard to the matters referred to in subsection (1)(c).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: group of companies (公司集團) means a group of companies within the meaning of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an employee is transferred within the same group of companies if the termination of the employment of the employee by one employer is immediately followed by the employment of the employee by another employer, both employers being at that time within the same group of companies; and a reference to transfer of employment within the same group of companies shall be construed accordingly.

subsection.content: Nothing in this section shall prejudice the operation of section 8(2) and (3).

section.name: s14
section.heading: Exception for existing employment on local and overseas terms of employment

subsection.leadIn: Nothing in section 10 renders unlawful—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any differential treatment by an employer in or in connection with employing an employee on local terms of employment on the one hand and employing another employee on overseas terms of employment on the other hand in accordance with those two sets of terms respectively; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any differential treatment by an employer in or in connection with employing on overseas terms of employment an employee who is a national or citizen of a country or place on the one hand and employing also on those terms another employee who is a national or citizen of another country or place on the other hand in accordance with those terms.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) applies only to an employee in an existing employment as specified in Schedule 2.

subsection.def: In this section, local terms of employment (本地僱用條款) and overseas terms of employment (海外僱用條款) have the meanings assigned to them respectively by section 11 of Schedule 2.

subsection.content: Nothing in this section shall prejudice the operation of section 8(2) and (3).

This section applies to any work for a person (the principal) that is available for doing by individuals (contract workers) who are employed not by the principal himself or herself but by a contractor or sub-contractor of the principal.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for the principal, in relation to work to which this section applies, to discriminate against a contract worker—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the terms on which the principal allows that contract worker to do that work;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by not allowing the contract worker to do it or continue to do it;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the way the principal affords the contract worker access to any benefits, facilities or services, or by refusing or deliberately omitting to afford him or her access to them; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by subjecting the contract worker to any other detriment.

subsection.content: The principal does not contravene subsection (2)(b) by doing any act in relation to a person not of a particular racial group at a time when, if the work were to be done by a person taken into the principal’s employment, being of that racial group would be a genuine occupational qualification for the job.

Without prejudice to section 8(2) and (3), nothing in this section renders unlawful any act done by the principal for the benefit of a contract worker not ordinarily resident in Hong Kong in or in connection with allowing the contract worker to do work to which this section applies, where the purpose of the contract worker’s being allowed to do that work is to provide him or her with training in skills which he or she appears to the principal to intend to exercise wholly outside Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to section 8(2) and (3), nothing in this section renders unlawful any act done by the principal for the benefit of any contract worker in or in connection with allowing the contract worker to do work to which this section applies, where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the work requires special skills, knowledge or experience not readily available in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the contract worker—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: possesses those skills, knowledge or experience; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: comes to do the work from a place outside Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the act is reasonably done for a person who comes from that place, having regard to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the prevailing terms of employment offered to persons with those skills, knowledge or experience in places outside Hong Kong; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any other relevant circumstances (other than the race of the person).

subsection.content: Subsection (2)(c) does not apply to benefits, facilities or services of any description if the principal is concerned with the provision (for payment or not) of benefits, facilities or services of that description to the public, or to a section of the public to which the contract worker in question belongs, unless that provision differs in a material respect from the provision of the benefits, facilities or services by the principal to his or her contract workers.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: contractor (承判商) means a person who undertakes any work for the principal under a contract that is entered into by the person directly with the principal;

sub-contractor (次承判商) means a person who enters into a contract with another person (whether or not a contractor of the principal) to undertake all or any part of the work that a contractor of the principal has undertaken.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Meaning of employment at establishment in Hong Kong

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Ordinance (the relevant purposes), employment is to be regarded as being at an establishment in Hong Kong unless the employee does his or her work wholly or mainly outside Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: employment on board a ship registered in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: employment on an aircraft or a dynamically supported craft registered in Hong Kong and operated by a person whose principal place of business is in Hong Kong or who is ordinarily resident in Hong Kong,

subsection.continued: but for the relevant purposes such employment is to be regarded as being at an establishment in Hong Kong unless the employee does his or her work wholly outside Hong Kong.

subsection.content: In the case of employment on board a ship registered in Hong Kong (except where the employee does his or her work wholly outside Hong Kong) the ship is deemed for the relevant purposes to be the establishment.

Where work is not done at an establishment it is to be treated for the relevant purposes as done at the establishment from which it is done or (where it is not done from any establishment) at the establishment with which it has the closest connection.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a firm consisting of not less than 6 partners, in relation to a position as partner in the firm, to discriminate against a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the arrangements they make for the purpose of determining who should be offered that position;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the terms on which they offer the person that position;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by refusing, or deliberately omitting to offer, the person that position; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in a case where the person already holds that position—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the way they afford the person access to any benefits, facilities or services, or by refusing or deliberately omitting to afford him or her access to them; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by expelling the person from that position, or subjecting him or her to any other detriment.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) applies in relation to persons proposing to form themselves into a partnership as it applies in relation to a firm.
Subsection (1)(a) and (c) does not apply to a position as partner, where, if it were employment, being of a particular racial group would be a genuine occupational qualification for the job.

Subject to subsection (5), subsection (1)(b) and (d) does not apply to provision in relation to death or retirement for a person made before the commencement date* in so far as any such provision continues for that person on and after that date.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1)(b) and (d) applies to provision made in relation to retirement of the kind mentioned in subsection (4) in so far as, in its application to such provision, it renders it unlawful for a firm to discriminate against a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in such of the terms on which the firm offers the person a position as partner as provide for his or her expulsion from that position; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by expelling the person from a position as partner or subjecting him or her to any detriment which results in his or her expulsion from such a position.

subsection.content: In the case of a limited partnership, references in subsection (1) to a partner shall be construed as references to a general partner within the meaning of section 2(1) of the Limited Partnerships Ordinance (Cap. 37).

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend subsection (1) by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: substituting another number for the number appearing in that subsection; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: repealing the words and number appearing after “for a firm” and before “, in relation to”.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Organizations of workers or employers or professional or trade organizations, etc.

subsection.content: This section applies to an organization of workers, an organization of employers, an organization of both workers and employers, or any other organization whose members carry on a particular profession or trade for the purposes of which the organization exists.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for an organization to which this section applies, in the case of a person who is not a member of the organization, to discriminate against the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the terms on which it is prepared to admit the person to membership; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by refusing, or deliberately omitting to accept, the person’s application for membership.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for an organization to which this section applies, in the case of a person who is a member of the organization, to discriminate against the person—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: by depriving the person of his or her membership, or varying the terms on which he or she is a member; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by subjecting the person to any other detriment.

subsection.content: This section does not apply to provision in relation to the death or retirement from work of a member made before the commencement date* in so far as any such provision continues for that member on and after that date.

Where, immediately before the enactment of this Ordinance, the main object of an organization to which this section applies was to enable the benefits of membership to be enjoyed by persons of a particular racial group (defined otherwise than by reference to colour), then, in so far as that continues to be its main object, this section is not to be construed as affecting that object and does not render unlawful an act which is done in order to give effect to that object.

subsection.leadIn: In determining whether the main object of an organization to which this section applies is as stated in subsection (5), regard shall be had to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the essential character of the organization;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the extent to which the affairs of the organization are so conducted that the persons primarily enjoying the benefits of membership are of the racial group in question; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other relevant circumstances.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for an authority or body which can confer an authorization or qualification which is needed for, or facilitates, engagement in a particular profession or trade to discriminate against a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the terms on which it is prepared to confer on the person that authorization or qualification;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by refusing, or deliberately omitting to grant, the person’s application for it; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by withdrawing it from the person or varying the terms on which he or she holds it.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not render unlawful any requirement for proficiency in either Chinese or English, or in both of them (whether or not to equivalent or comparable levels) imposed for the conferment of an authorization or qualification if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the requirement is reasonable, having regard to the demands of, or associated with, the profession or trade concerned; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without prejudice to paragraph (a), the authorization or qualification is one specified in Schedule 3.

subsection.leadIn: Where an authority or body is required by law to satisfy itself as to a person’s good character before conferring on the person an authorization or qualification which is needed for, or facilitates, the person’s engagement in any profession or trade then, without prejudice to any other duty to which it is subject, that requirement shall be taken to impose on the authority or body a duty to have regard to any evidence tending to show that the person, or any of his or her employees or agents (whether past or present), has—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: practised unlawful discrimination;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: engaged in unlawful harassment; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: engaged in acts which contravene section 45,

subsection.continued: in, or in connection with, the carrying on of any profession or trade.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not apply to discrimination which is rendered unlawful by section 26.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: authorization or qualification (授權或資格) includes recognition, licensing, registration, enrolment, approval and certification;
confer (授予) includes renew or extend.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Persons concerned with provision of vocational training

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful, in the case of a person (the first-mentioned person) seeking or undergoing training which would help to fit him or her for employment, for any person (the second-mentioned person) who provides, or makes arrangements for the provision of, facilities for such training to discriminate against the first-mentioned person—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: by refusing, or deliberately omitting to afford, the first-mentioned person such access;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by terminating the first-mentioned person’s training; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by subjecting the first-mentioned person to any other detriment during the course of his or her training.

subsection.leadIn: Nothing in subsection (1) is to be construed as requiring a person who provides, or makes arrangements for the provision of, facilities for such training—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to modify for persons of any racial group its arrangements regarding holidays or medium of instruction; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to make different arrangements regarding holidays or medium of instruction for persons of any racial group.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: discrimination which is rendered unlawful by any of the provisions of section 10 or 26; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: discrimination which would be rendered unlawful by any of those provisions but for the operation of any other provision of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for an employment agency to discriminate against a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the terms on which the agency offers to provide any of its services;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by refusing, or deliberately omitting to provide, any of its services; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the way it provides any of its services.

subsection.content: References in subsection (1) to the services of an employment agency include guidance on careers and any other services related to employment.
This section does not apply if the discrimination only concerns employment which the employer could lawfully refuse to offer the person.

subsection.leadIn: An employment agency is not subject to any liability under this section if it proves—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that it acted in reliance on a statement made to it by the employer to the effect that, by reason of the operation of subsection (3), its action would not be unlawful; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that it was reasonable for it to rely on the statement.

subsection.content: A person who knowingly or recklessly makes a statement of the kind referred to in subsection (4)(a) which in a material respect is false or misleading commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4.

This section applies to any work for a person (the principal) that is available for doing by individuals (commission agents) as the agents of the principal and who are remunerated, whether in whole or in part, by commission.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for the principal, in relation to work to which this section applies, to discriminate against a person who is a commission agent—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the terms on which he or she allows the person to do that work;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by not allowing the person to do it or continue to do it;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the way he or she affords the person access to any benefits, facilities or services, or by refusing or deliberately omitting to afford the person access to them; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by subjecting the person to any other detriment.

subsection.content: The principal does not contravene subsection (2)(b) by doing any act in relation to a person not of a particular racial group at a time when, if the work were to be done by a person taken into the principal’s employment, being of that racial group would be a genuine occupational qualification for the job.

Subsection (2)(c) does not apply to benefits, facilities or services of any description if the principal is concerned with the provision (for payment or not) of benefits, facilities or services of that description to the public, or to a section of the public to which the person belongs, unless that provision differs in a material respect from the provision of the benefits, facilities or services by the principal to his or her commission agents.

Nothing in this Part applies to employment for the purposes of an organized religion where the employment is limited to a particular racial group so as to comply with the doctrines of the religion or to avoid offending the religious susceptibilities common to its followers.

Nothing in section 19 applies to an authorization or qualification (within the meaning of that section) for the purposes of an organized religion where the authorization or qualification is limited to a particular racial group so as to comply with the doctrines of the religion or to avoid offending the religious susceptibilities common to its followers.
It is unlawful for a person, in relation to employment by that person at an establishment in Hong Kong, to harass a person who is seeking to be employed by that person.
It is unlawful for a person (the first-mentioned person), in the case of a person employed by that first-mentioned person at an establishment in Hong Kong, to harass that other person.

It is unlawful for a person, who is employed by another person (the second-mentioned person) at an establishment in Hong Kong to harass a person who is seeking to be, or who is, employed by that second-mentioned person.
It is unlawful for the principal, in relation to work to which section 15 applies, to harass another person who is a contract worker.
It is unlawful for a contract worker to harass another person who is a fellow contract worker.
It is unlawful for a partner of a firm to harass a person who is seeking to be, or who is, a partner in the firm.
Subsection (6) applies in relation to persons proposing to form themselves into a partnership as it applies in relation to a firm.
Section 17(6) applies to subsection (6) as it applies to section 17(1).
It is unlawful for the principal, in relation to work to which section 22 applies, to harass a person who is a commission agent.
It is unlawful for a commission agent to harass a person who is a fellow commission agent.
It is unlawful for a person who is seeking to be, or who is, employed by a person at an establishment in Hong Kong to harass the second-mentioned person.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a person residing in any premises to harass another person who is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: employed by a third person at an establishment in Hong Kong (whether or not the third person also resides in those premises and whether or not those premises are that establishment); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: carrying out in those premises all or part of his or her work in relation to the employment (whether or not he or she resides in those premises).

subsection.content: It is unlawful for a person who is a workplace participant to harass another person who is also a workplace participant at a workplace of them both.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: workplace (工作場所), in relation to a person, means a place—(a)at which the person works as a workplace participant; or(b)that the person attends as a workplace participant;

workplace participant (場所使用者) means—(a)an employee;(b)an employer;(c)a contract worker;(d)the principal, within the meaning of section 15(1), of a contract worker;(e)a commission agent;(f)the principal, within the meaning of section 22(1), of a commission agent;(g)a partner in a firm;(h)an intern; or(i)a volunteer.

subsection.content: It is unlawful for a member of an organization to which section 18 applies to harass a person who is seeking to be, or who is, a member of that organization.

It is unlawful for a member of an authority or body referred to in section 19 to harass a person who is seeking an authorization or qualification (within the meaning of that section) which can be conferred by the authority or body or to harass a person holding such an authorization or qualification. This subsection does not apply to harrassment which is rendered unlawful by section 38.

It is unlawful for a person to harass another person who is seeking or undergoing training which would help to fit that other person for any employment if the person provides, or makes arrangements for the provision of, facilities for such training. This subsection does not apply to harassment which is rendered unlawful by section 24(1) or (2) or 38.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: operates an employment agency; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is a member of the staff of an employment agency,

subsection.continued: to harass a person to whom the agency provides any of the agency’s services or who is seeking the provision of such services.

part.name: P4
part.heading: Discrimination and Harassment in Other Fields

section.name: s26
section.heading: Discrimination by responsible bodies for educational establishments

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for the responsible body for an educational establishment to discriminate against a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the terms on which it offers to admit that person to the establishment as a student;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by refusing, or deliberately omitting to accept, an application for that person’s admission to the establishment as a student; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: where the person is a student of the establishment—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the way it affords the person access to any benefits, facilities or services, or by refusing or deliberately omitting to afford the person access to them; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: by expelling the person from the establishment or subjecting him or her to any other detriment.

subsection.leadIn: Nothing in subsection (1) is to be construed as requiring the responsible body for an educational establishment—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to modify for persons of any racial group arrangements of the establishment regarding holidays or medium of instruction; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to make different arrangements regarding holidays or medium of instruction for persons of any racial group.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Discrimination in provision of goods, facilities or services

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for any person (the first-mentioned person) concerned with the provision (for payment or not) of goods, facilities or services to the public or a section of the public to discriminate against another person (the second-mentioned person) who seeks to obtain or use those goods, facilities or services—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by refusing, or deliberately omitting to provide, the second-mentioned person with any of them; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by refusing or deliberately omitting to provide the second-mentioned person with goods, facilities or services of the like quality, in the like manner and on the like terms as are normal in the first-mentioned person’s case in relation to other members of the public or (where the second-mentioned person belongs to a section of the public) to other members of that section.

subsection.leadIn: The following are examples of the facilities and services referred to in subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: access to and use of any place which members of the public or a section of the public are permitted to enter;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accommodation in a hotel, guesthouse or other similar establishment;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: facilities by way of banking or insurance or for grants, loans, credit or finance;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: facilities for education;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: facilities for entertainment, recreation or refreshment;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: facilities for transport or travel;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the services of any profession or trade;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: the services of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any department of the Government; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any undertaking by or of the Government.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Discrimination in disposal or management of premises

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a person, in relation to premises in Hong Kong of which that person has power to dispose, to discriminate against another person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the terms on which the person offers that other person the premises;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by refusing the other person’s application for those premises; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the person’s treatment of the other person in relation to any list of persons in need of the premises of that description.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a person, in relation to premises managed by that person, to discriminate against another person (the second-mentioned person)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the way he or she affords the second-mentioned person access to any benefits or facilities, or by refusing or deliberately omitting to afford the second-mentioned person access to them; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by evicting the second-mentioned person, or subjecting him or her to any other detriment.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not apply to a person who owns an estate or interest in the premises and wholly occupies them unless the person uses the services of an estate agent for the purposes of the disposal of the premises, or publishes or causes to be published, an advertisement in connection with the disposal.

subsection.def: In this section, power to dispose (有權處置), in relation to premises, includes the power to sell, rent, let, sub-let or otherwise part with possession of those premises.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Discrimination: consent for assignment or sub-letting

subsection.content: Where the licence or consent of a landlord or of any other person is required for the disposal to any person of premises in Hong Kong comprised in a tenancy, it is unlawful for the landlord or other person to discriminate against a person (assignee/sublettee) by withholding the licence or consent for disposal of the premises to the assignee/sublettee.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person withholding the licence or consent or a near relative of that person (the relevant occupier) resides, and intends to continue to reside, on the premises;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is on the premises, in addition to the accommodation occupied by the relevant occupier, accommodation (not being storage accommodation or means of access) shared by the relevant occupier with other persons residing on the premises who are not members of the relevant occupier’s household; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the premises are small premises as construed according to section 30(2).

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, it is declared that this section applies to tenancies created before the enactment of this Ordinance as well as to tenancies created on or after the enactment of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: disposal (處置), in relation to premises comprised in a tenancy, includes assignment of the tenancy and sub-letting or parting with possession of the premises or any part of the premises;

def.name: Tenancy
def.leadIn: tenancy (租賃) means a tenancy created—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by a lease or sub-lease;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by a tenancy agreement; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: pursuant to any agreement.

subsection.leadIn: Sections 27(1) and 28 do not apply to the provision by a person of accommodation in any premises, or the disposal of premises, by the person, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that person or a near relative of that person (the relevant occupier) resides, and intends to continue to reside, on the premises;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is on the premises, in addition to the accommodation occupied by the relevant occupier, accommodation (not being storage accommodation or means of access) shared by the relevant occupier with other persons residing on the premises who are not members of the relevant occupier’s household; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the premises are small premises.

subsection.leadIn: Premises are to be treated for the purposes of subsection (1) as small premises if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of premises comprising residential accommodation for one or more households (under separate letting or similar agreements) in addition to the accommodation occupied by the relevant occupier—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: there is not normally residential accommodation on the premises for more than 2 such households; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: only the relevant occupier and any member of his or her household reside in the accommodation occupied by the relevant occupier; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of premises not falling within paragraph (a), there is not normally residential accommodation on the premises for more than 6 persons in addition to the relevant occupier and any members of his or her household.

subsection.content: The Chief Executive in Council may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend subsection (2)(b) by substituting another number for the number appearing in that subsection.

subsection.leadIn: Sections 27(1) and 28 are not to be construed as rendering unlawful—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the restriction of membership of any voluntary body to persons of a particular racial group (disregarding any minor exceptions); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the provision of benefits, facilities or services to members of any voluntary body where the membership is so restricted,

subsection.continued: even though membership of the body is open to the public, or to a section of the public.

subsection.leadIn: Nothing in section 27(1) or 28—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is to be construed as affecting a specified provision; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: renders unlawful an act which is done in order to give effect to a specified provision.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified provision (指明規定) means a provision for conferring benefits on persons of a particular racial group (disregarding any benefits to persons of another racial group which are exceptional or are relatively insignificant), being a provision which constitutes the main object of a voluntary body;
voluntary body (志願團體) means a body the activities of which are carried on otherwise than for profit.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Exceptions for cemeteries
section.leadIn: Nothing in section 27(1), 28 or 29(1) renders unlawful—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any act to set aside or allocate a cemetery, crematorium or columbarium (in whole or in part) for the reception of human remains of persons belonging to any particular community, race or religion;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any act to provide goods, facilities or services in a cemetery, crematorium or columbarium, or part of it, that is so set aside or allocated; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any act done in connection with an act referred to in paragraph (a) or (b).

subsection.content: Section 27(1) does not apply to anything done by a person as a participant in arrangements under which he or she (for reward or not) takes into his or her home, and treats as if they were members of his or her family, any children, elderly persons or persons requiring a special degree of care and attention.

subsection.leadIn: Sections 27(1) and 28 do not apply—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to discrimination which is rendered unlawful by any provision or Part of this Ordinance specified in column 2 of Schedule 4; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to discrimination which would be so unlawful but for any provision or Part of this Ordinance specified in column 3 of that Schedule.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Discrimination in eligibility to stand for election, etc.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a person to discriminate against another person in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determining the eligibility of a person to stand for election to a relevant body or relevant position, or to be selected for a relevant position;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: determining the eligibility of a person to vote in elections of members of a relevant body or the holder of a relevant position;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: considering whether a person should be appointed as a member of a relevant body, where some or all of the members of that body are appointed; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: considering whether a person should be appointed to a relevant position, approved as a member of a relevant body or recognized as holding a relevant position.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to a relevant body means a public body, a public authority, a statutory advisory body, or a prescribed body;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to a relevant position includes membership of a public body, a public authority, and a prescribed position.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Discrimination by, or in relation to, barristers

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a barrister or barrister’s clerk, in relation to any offer of a pupillage or a tenancy, to discriminate against a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the arrangements which are made for the purpose of determining to whom it should be offered;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in respect of any terms on which it is offered; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by refusing, or deliberately omitting, to offer it to that person.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a barrister or barrister’s clerk, in relation to a person who is a pupil or a tenant in the chambers concerned, to discriminate against that person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in respect of any terms applicable to that person as a pupil or a tenant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the opportunities for training, or gaining experience, which are afforded or denied to that person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the benefits, facilities or services which are afforded or denied to that person; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by terminating that person’s pupillage or by subjecting him or her to any pressure to leave the chambers or other detriment.

subsection.content: It is unlawful for any person, in relation to the giving, withholding or acceptance of instructions to a barrister, to discriminate against a person.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: barrister’s clerk (大律師書記) includes any person carrying out any of the functions of a barrister’s clerk;
pupil (見習大律師), pupillage (見習職位), tenancy (租賃) and tenant (承租人) have the meanings commonly associated with their use in the context of a set of barrister’s chambers.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a club, the committee of management of a club or a member of the committee of management of a club to discriminate against a person who is not a member of the club—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by refusing or failing to accept the person’s application for membership; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the terms or conditions on which the club is prepared to admit the person to membership.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a club, the committee of management of a club or a member of the committee of management of a club to discriminate against a person who is a member of the club—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by refusing or failing to accept the person’s application for a particular class or type of membership;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the terms or conditions of membership that is afforded to the person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by denying the person access, or limiting his or her access, to any benefits, services or facilities provided by the club;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by depriving the person of membership or varying the terms of membership; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: by subjecting the person to any other detriment.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Exception from section 36 for certain clubs

subsection.content: Section 36 does not apply to, or in relation to, a club the main object of which is to enable the benefits of membership to be enjoyed by persons of a particular racial group defined otherwise than by reference to colour.

subsection.leadIn: In determining whether the main object of a club is as stated in subsection (1), regard shall be had to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the essential character of the club;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the extent to which the affairs of the club are so conducted that the persons primarily enjoying the benefits of membership are of the racial group in question; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other relevant circumstances.

subsection.leadIn: Where the main object of a club is to enable the benefits of membership to be enjoyed by persons of a number of different racial groups defined otherwise than by reference to colour—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: nothing in section 36 shall render unlawful any arrangements concerning membership which is designed to give effect to such object; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: nothing in section 36 shall render unlawful a provision to which this paragraph applies or any act done in order to give effect to such a provision.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (3)(b) applies to a provision which is designed to ensure that the committee of management of the club includes, in relation to each of the relevant racial groups, a minimum number of members, and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: which for that purpose—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: reserves seats for each of those racial groups on that committee; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: makes extra seats available for persons of any such racial group when the number of persons of that racial group in the other seats falls below the minimum; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which, in the opinion of the club or its committee of management, is needed in the circumstances to secure a reasonable lower limit to the number of members of each of those racial groups serving on the committee.

subsection.leadIn: In determining whether the main object of a club is as stated in subsection (3), regard shall be had to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the essential character of the club;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the extent to which the affairs of the club are so conducted that the persons primarily enjoying the benefits of membership are of the different racial groups in question; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other relevant circumstances.

subsection.content: It is unlawful for a person who is, or is a member of, the responsible body for an educational establishment to harass a person who is seeking to be, or who is, a student of the establishment.
It is unlawful for a person who is a member of the staff of an educational establishment to harass a person who is seeking to be, or who is, a student of the establishment.
It is unlawful for a person who is a student of an educational establishment to harass a person who is seeking to be, or who is, a student of the establishment.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a person who is seeking to be, or who is, a student of an educational establishment to harass a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who is, or is a member of, the responsible body for the establishment; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who is a member of the staff of the establishment.

subsection.content: It is unlawful for a person concerned with the provision of goods, facilities or services to harass another person who seeks to obtain or use those goods, facilities or services or to whom the person provides those goods, facilities or services.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful for a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: seeks to obtain or use goods, facilities or services; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is provided with goods, facilities or services,

subsection.continued: to harass another person who is concerned with the provision of the goods, facilities or services. (Added 8 of 2020 s. 36)

subsection.content: It is unlawful for a person, in relation to premises in Hong Kong of which that person has power to dispose, to harass another person who applies for those premises.
It is unlawful for a person, in relation to premises managed by that person, to harass a person occupying the premises.

Where the licence or consent of the landlord or of any other person is required for the disposal to any person of premises in Hong Kong comprised in a tenancy, it is unlawful for the landlord or other person to harass a person seeking the licence or consent for the disposal of the premises to him or her, or a person from whom the licence or consent is withheld.
Subsections (1), (1A), (2), (3) and (4) do not apply to harassment which is rendered unlawful by section 24, 24A, 25 or 38. (Amended 8 of 2020 ss. 31 & 36)
Section 29(4) applies to subsection (4) as it applies to section 29.
It is unlawful for a barrister or barrister’s clerk, in relation to any chambers, to harass a person who is, or has applied to be, a pupil or tenant in the chambers.
It is unlawful for any person, in the course of giving, withholding or acceptance of instructions to a barrister, to harass a person.
Section 35(4) applies to subsections (7) and (8) as it applies to section 35.
It is unlawful for a club, the committee of management of a club or a member of the committee of management of a club to harass a person who is, or has applied to be, a member of the club.

subsection.leadIn: Section 27(1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: does not apply to goods, facilities or services outside Hong Kong except as provided in subsections (2) and (3); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: does not apply to facilities—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: by way of banking or insurance; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for grants, loans, credit or finance,

paragraph.continued: where the facilities are for a purpose to be carried out, or in connection with risks wholly or mainly arising, outside Hong Kong.

subsection.content: Section 27(1) applies to the provision of facilities for travel outside Hong Kong where the refusal or omission occurs in Hong Kong or on a ship, aircraft or dynamically supported craft referred to in subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: Section 27(1) applies on and in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any ship registered in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any aircraft or dynamically supported craft registered in Hong Kong and operated by a person whose principal place of business is in Hong Kong or who is ordinarily resident in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any ship, aircraft or dynamically supported craft belonging to or possessed by the Government,

subsection.continued: even if the ship, aircraft or craft is outside Hong Kong.

subsection.content: This section does not render unlawful an act done in or over a place outside Hong Kong, or in or over that place’s territorial waters for the purpose of complying with the laws of that place.

subsection.leadIn: Section 26 does not apply to benefits, facilities or services outside Hong Kong except—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: travel on a ship registered in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: benefits, facilities or services provided on a ship so registered.

subsection.content: Section 39(1) and (1A) does not apply to an act of harassment that is committed outside Hong Kong except as provided in subsection (7). (Added 8 of 2020 s. 38)

Section 39(1) and (1A) applies to an act of harassment that is committed on a ship, aircraft or dynamically supported craft referred to in subsection (3)(a), (b) or (c) even if it is outside Hong Kong when the act is committed. (Added 8 of 2020 s. 38)

def.name: DiscriminatoryPractice
def.leadIn: In this section, discriminatory practice (歧視性的做法) means the application of a requirement or condition—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which results in an act of discrimination which is unlawful by virtue of any provision of Part 3 or 4 as read with section 4(1)(b); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which would be likely to result in such an act of discrimination if the persons to whom it is applied were not all of the same racial group.

subsection.leadIn: A person acts in contravention of this section if and so long as the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: applies a discriminatory practice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: operates practices or other arrangements which in any circumstances would call for the application by the person of a discriminatory practice.

subsection.content: Proceedings in respect of a contravention of this section may be brought only by the Commission and any such proceedings must be brought in accordance with sections 71, 72, 73, 74 and 75.

It is unlawful to publish or cause to be published an advertisement which indicates, or might reasonably be understood as indicating, an intention by a person to do any act which is or might be unlawful by virtue of Part 3 or 4.
Subsection (1) does not apply to an advertisement if the intended act would not in fact be unlawful.

For the purposes of subsection (1), use of a job description which is specific with reference to race is to be taken to indicate an intention to discriminate, unless the advertisement contains an indication to the contrary.

subsection.leadIn: The publisher of an advertisement made unlawful by subsection (1) is not subject to any liability under that subsection in respect of the publication of the advertisement if the publisher proves—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the advertisement was published in reliance on a statement made to the publisher by the person who caused it to be published to the effect that, by reason of the operation of subsection (2), the publication would not be unlawful; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that it was reasonable for the publisher to rely on the statement.

subsection.content: A person who knowingly or recklessly makes a statement of the kind referred to in subsection (4)(a) which in a material respect is false or misleading commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at leve1 4.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Instructions to discriminate
section.leadIn: It is unlawful for a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who has authority over another person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in accordance with whose wishes that other person is accustomed to act,

section.continued: to instruct that other person to do any act which is unlawful by virtue of Part 3 or 4, or procure or attempt to procure the doing by him or her of any such act.

subsection.leadIn: It is unlawful to induce, or attempt to induce, a person to do any act which contravenes Part 3 or 4 by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: providing or offering to provide the person with any benefit; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subjecting or threatening to subject the person to any detriment.

subsection.content: An offer or threat is not prevented from falling within subsection (1) because it is not made directly to the person concerned, if it is made in such a way that he or she is likely to hear of it.

It is unlawful for a person, by any activity in public, to incite hatred towards, serious contempt for, or severe ridicule of, another person or members of a class of persons on the ground of the race of the person or members of the class of persons.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), it is immaterial whether a person is actually incited, by an activity, to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: hatred towards;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: serious contempt for; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: severe ridicule of,

subsection.continued: another person or members of a class of persons on the ground of the race of the person or members of the class of persons.

subsection.leadIn: Nothing in this section renders unlawful—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a fair report on an activity in public;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an activity in public that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is a communication or the distribution or dissemination of any matter; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: consists of a publication which is subject to a defence of absolute privilege in proceedings for defamation; or

paragraph.name: c
